etymology.description: phonetic: 夂 (zhǐ, “end”) + semantic: 日 (“day”) or 仌 (“ice”); also analyzed as ideogrammic.
etymology.interpretation: Often read as depicting the end of the day/year or the presence of ice, evoking the cold season. The element 夂 supplies the sound (OC *tuːŋ, aligning with dōng) and also hints at finality.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢冬至吃饺子(我喜歡冬至吃餃子)。
examples.english: I like to eat dumplings at the Winter Solstice.

examples.chinese: 冬季常下雪(冬季常下雪)。
